entry.title: New Yorker Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the New Yorker Hotel (pictured) once had the largest private power plant in the United States?

entry.title: Tuệ Tĩnh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that fourteenth-century Buddhist monk Tuệ Tĩnh is referred to as a founding father of traditional Vietnamese medicine?

entry.title: 2022 Ticketmaster controversy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2022 Ticketmaster controversy over Taylor Swift's the Eras Tour has triggered investigations by several U.S. state attorneys general and the federal Department of Justice?

entry.title: Hernán Galíndez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ecuadorian footballer Hernán Galíndez won a bicycle for beating a team featuring Lionel Messi when they were children?

entry.title: 1937 Fleischer Studios strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1937 Fleischer Studios strike in New York City was the first major labor strike in the animation industry?

entry.title: R. R. Bolgar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cambridge don R. R. Bolgar was heard to say that if it had not been for a misfortune, he might well have supported the Nazis as a landowner in Moravia and been murdered by the Russians?

entry.title: Senior Partner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Panasonic's Senior Partner and Executive Partner portable computers weighed between 28 and 31 lb and featured built-in printers?

entry.title: a Hawaii radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Hawaii radio station couldn't buy a KISS?
